[ X ]

The rhetoric from which environmental conservation is approached often uses the language of modernity – the very rhetoric that constructs the imaginary of coloniality in which the Mediterranean serves as the epicenter.

The Ecology of Invasion is central for symbolic overhaul. According to Elleke Boehmer, “decolonization demanded –and still demands– symbolic overhaul, a reshaping of dominant meanings”.

The Mediterranean gives shape to a symbolic matrix in which, under the rhetoric of invasion, extractivist, protectionist, racist, Eurocentric and expulsive interests are embedded.

Thus, what often occurs is that from a Western perspective, the Global South and its inhabitants (human and non-human) are perceived as the invading Other.
